00017 package WeBWorK::PG::Local;
00018 use base qw(WeBWorK::PG);
00019 
00020 =head1 NAME
00021 
00022 WeBWorK::PG::Local - Use the WeBWorK::PG API to invoke a local
00023 WeBWorK::PG::Translator object.
00024 
00025 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00026 
00027 WeBWorK::PG::Local encapsulates the PG translation process, making multiple
00028 calls to WeBWorK::PG::Translator. Much of the flexibility of the Translator is
00029 hidden, instead making choices that are appropriate for the webwork2
00030 system
00031 
00032 It implements the WeBWorK::PG interface and uses a local
00033 WeBWorK::PG::Translator to perform problem rendering. See the documentation for
00034 the WeBWorK::PG module for information about the API.
00035 
00036 =cut
00037 
00038 use strict;
00039 use warnings;
00040 use WeBWorK::Constants;
00041 use File::Path qw(rmtree);
00042 use WeBWorK::PG::Translator;
00043 use WeBWorK::Utils qw(readFile writeTimingLogEntry);
00044 #use WeBWorK::Utils::RestrictedMailer;
00045 use WeBWorK::Utils::DelayedMailer;
00046 
00047 use mod_perl;
00048 use constant MP2 => ( exists $ENV{MOD_PERL_API_VERSION} and $ENV{MOD_PERL_API_VERSION} >= 2 );
00049 
00050 # Problem processing will time out after this number of seconds.
00051 use constant TIMEOUT => $WeBWorK::PG::Local::TIMEOUT || 10;
00052 
00053 BEGIN {
00054     # This safe compartment is used to read the large macro files such as
00055     # PG.pl, PGbasicmacros.pl and PGanswermacros and cache the results so that
00056     # future calls have preloaded versions of these large files. This saves a
00057     # significant amount of time.
00058     $WeBWorK::PG::Local::safeCache = new WWSafe;
00059 }
00060 
00061 sub alarm_handler {
00062     my $msg = "Timeout after processing this problem for ". TIMEOUT. " seconds. Check for infinite loops in problem source.\n";
00063     warn $msg;
00064     CORE::die $msg;
00065 }
00066 
00067 sub new {
00068     my $invocant = shift;
00069     local $SIG{ALRM} = \&alarm_handler;
00070     alarm TIMEOUT;
00071     my $result = eval { $invocant->new_helper(@_) };
00072     alarm 0;
00073     die $@ if $@;
00074     return $result;
00075 }
00076 
00077 
00078 sub new_helper {
00079     my $invocant = shift;
00080     my $class = ref($invocant) || $invocant;
00081     my (
00082         $ce,
00083         $user,
00084         $key,
00085         $set,
00086         $problem,
00087         $psvn, #FIXME -- not used
00088         $formFields, # in CGI::Vars format
00089         $translationOptions, # hashref containing options for the
00090                              # translator, such as whether to show
00091                              # hints and the display mode to use
00092     ) = @_;
00093     
00094     # write timing log entry
00095 #   writeTimingLogEntry($ce, "WeBWorK::PG::new",
00096 #       "user=".$user->user_id.",problem=".$ce->{courseName}."/".$set->set_id."/".$problem->problem_id.",mode=".$translationOptions->{displayMode},
00097 #       "begin");
00098     
00099     # install a local warn handler to collect warnings  FIXME -- figure out what I meant to do here.
00100     my $warnings = "";
00101     #local $SIG{__WARN__} = sub { $warnings .= shift()."<br/>\n"};
00102         #if $ce->{pg}->{options}->{catchWarnings};
00103     
00104     # create a Translator
00105     #warn "PG: creating a Translator\n"; 
00106     my $translator = WeBWorK::PG::Translator->new;
00107     
00108     # set the directory hash
00109     #warn "PG: setting the directory hash\n";
00110     # FIXME rh_directories does not appear to be used. ever.
00111 #   $translator->rh_directories({
00112 #       macrosPath             => $ce->{courseDirs}->{macrosPath},
00113 #       templateDirectory      => $ce->{courseDirs}->{templates},
00114 #       tempDirectory          => $ce->{courseDirs}->{html_temp},
00115 #   });
00116     
00117     ############################################################################
00118     # evaluate modules and "extra packages"
00119     ############################################################################
00120     
00121     #warn "PG: evaluating modules and \"extra packages\"\n";
00122     my @modules = @{ $ce->{pg}->{modules} };
00123     # HACK for apache2
00124     if (MP2) {
00125         push @modules, ["Apache2::Log"], ["APR::Table"];
00126     } else {
00127         push @modules, ["Apache::Log"];
00128     }
00129     foreach my $module_packages_ref (@modules) {
00130         my ($module, @extra_packages) = @$module_packages_ref;
00131         # the first item is the main package
00132         $translator->evaluate_modules($module);
00133         # the remaining items are "extra" packages
00134         $translator->load_extra_packages(@extra_packages);
00135     }
00136     
00137     ############################################################################
00138     # prepare an imagegenerator object (if we're in "images" mode)
00139     ############################################################################
00140     my $image_generator;
00141     if ($translationOptions->{displayMode} eq "images") {
00142         my %imagesModeOptions = %{$ce->{pg}{displayModeOptions}{images}};
00143         $image_generator = WeBWorK::PG::ImageGenerator->new(
00144             tempDir         => $ce->{webworkDirs}->{tmp}, # global temp dir
00145             latex           => $ce->{externalPrograms}->{latex},
00146             dvipng          => $ce->{externalPrograms}->{dvipng},
00147             useCache        => 1,
00148             cacheDir        => $ce->{webworkDirs}{equationCache},
00149             cacheURL        => $ce->{webworkURLs}{equationCache},
00150             cacheDB         => $ce->{webworkFiles}{equationCacheDB},
00151             useMarkers      => ($imagesModeOptions{dvipng_align} && $imagesModeOptions{dvipng_align} eq 'mysql'),
00152             dvipng_align    => $imagesModeOptions{dvipng_align},
00153             dvipng_depth_db => $imagesModeOptions{dvipng_depth_db},
00154         );
00155     }
00156     
00157     ############################################################################
00158     # create a "delayed mailer" object that will send emails after the page is finished.
00159     ############################################################################
00160 
00161     my $mailer = new WeBWorK::Utils::DelayedMailer(
00162         smtp_server => $ce->{mail}{smtpServer},
00163         smtp_sender => $ce->{mail}{smtpSender},
00164         smtp_timeout => $ce->{mail}{smtpTimeout},
00165         # FIXME I'd like to have an X-Remote-Host header, but before I do that I have to
00166         # factor out the remote host/remote port code from Feedback.pm and Authen.pm and
00167         # put it in Utils! (or maybe in WW::Request?)
00168         headers => "X-WeBWorK-Module: " . __PACKAGE__ . "\n"
00169             . "X-WeBWorK-Course: " . $ce->{courseName} . "\n"
00170             # can't add user-related information because this is used for anonymous questionnaires
00171             #. "X-WeBWorK-User: " . $user->user_id . "\n"
00172             #. "X-WeBWorK-Section: " . $user->section . "\n"
00173             #. "X-WeBWorK-Recitation: " . $user->recitation . "\n"
00174             . "X-WeBWorK-Set: " . $set->set_id . "\n"
00175             . "X-WeBWorK-Problem: " . $problem->problem_id . "\n"
00176             . "X-WeBWorK-PGSourceFile: " . $problem->source_file . "\n",
00177         allowed_recipients => $ce->{mail}{allowedRecipients},
00178         on_illegal_rcpt => "carp",
00179     );
00180     
00181     
00182     ############################################################################
00183     # set the environment (from defineProblemEnvir)
00184     ############################################################################
00185     
00186     #warn "PG: setting the environment (from defineProblemEnvir)\n";
00187     my $envir = $class->defineProblemEnvir(
00188         $ce,
00189         $user,
00190         $key,
00191         $set,
00192         $problem,
00193         $psvn, #FIXME -- not used
00194         $formFields,
00195         $translationOptions,
00196         { #extras (this is kind of a hack, but not a serious one)
00197             image_generator => $image_generator,
00198             mailer => $mailer,
00199         },
00200     );
00201     $translator->environment($envir);
00202     
00203     ############################################################################
00204     # initialize the Translator
00205     ############################################################################
00206     #warn "PG: initializing the Translator\n";
00207     $translator->initialize();
00208     
00209     
00210     ############################################################################
00211     # preload macros
00212     ############################################################################
00213     # This is in transition.  here are the old instructions
00214     
00215     # Preload the macros files which are used routinely: PG.pl,
00216     # dangerousMacros.pl, IO.pl, PGbasicmacros.pl, and PGanswermacros.pl
00217     # (Preloading the last two files safes a significant amount of time.)
00218     # 
00219     # IO.pl, PG.pl, and dangerousMacros.pl are loaded using
00220     # unrestricted_load This is hard wired into the
00221     # Translator::pre_load_macro_files subroutine. I'd like to change this
00222     # at some point to have the same sort of interface to global.conf that
00223     # the module loading does -- have a list of macros to load
00224     # unrestrictedly.
00225     #   
00226     # This has been replaced by the pre_load_macro_files subroutine.  It
00227     # loads AND caches the files. While PG.pl and dangerousMacros are not
00228     # large, they are referred to by PGbasicmacros and PGanswermacros.
00229     # Because these are loaded into the cached name space (e.g.
00230     # Safe::Root1::) all calls to, say NEW_ANSWER_NAME are actually calls
00231     # to Safe::Root1::NEW_ANSWER_NAME.  It is useful to have these names
00232     # inside the Safe::Root1: cached safe compartment.  (NEW_ANSWER_NAME
00233     # and all other subroutine names are also automatically exported into
00234     # the current safe compartment Safe::Rootx::
00235     # 
00236     # The headers of both PGbasicmacros and PGanswermacros has code that
00237     # insures that the constants used are imported into the current safe
00238     # compartment.  This involves evaluating references to, say
00239     # $main::displayMode, at runtime to insure that main refers to
00240     # Safe::Rootx:: and NOT to Safe::Root1::, which is the value of main::
00241     # at compile time.
00242     # 
00243     # TO ENABLE CACHEING UNCOMMENT THE FOLLOWING:
00244 #   eval{$translator->pre_load_macro_files(
00245 #       $WeBWorK::PG::Local::safeCache,
00246 #       $ce->{pg}->{directories}->{macros}, 
00247 #       #'PG.pl', 'dangerousMacros.pl','IO.pl','PGbasicmacros.pl','PGanswermacros.pl'
00248 #   )};
00249 #   warn "Error while preloading macro files: $@" if $@;
00250 
00251     ############################################################################
00252     # Here are the new instructions for preloading the macros
00253     ############################################################################
00254     
00255     # STANDARD LOADING CODE: for cached script files, this merely
00256     # initializes the constants.
00257     #2010 -- in the new scheme PG.pl is the only file guaranteed
00258     # initialization -- it reads in everything that dangerous macros
00259     # and IO.pl
00260     # did before.  Mostly it just defines access to the PGcore object
00261     
00262     # 2010 the loop is overkill since there is just one file, we'll leave it for now in case there are more.
00263     foreach (qw(PG.pl )) {   # dangerousMacros.pl IO.pl
00264         my $macroPath = $ce->{pg}->{directories}->{macros} . "/$_";
00265         my $err = $translator->unrestricted_load($macroPath);
00266         warn "Error while loading $macroPath: $err" if $err;
00267     }
00268     
00269     ############################################################################
00270     # set the opcode mask (using default values)
00271     ############################################################################
00272     #warn "PG: setting the opcode mask (using default values)\n";
00273     $translator->set_mask();
00274     
00275     ############################################################################
00276     # get the problem source
00277     # FIXME -- this operation can be moved out of the translator.
00278     ############################################################################
00279     #warn "PG: storing the problem source\n";
00280     my $source ='';
00281     my $sourceFilePath = '';
00282     my $readErrors = undef;
00283     if (ref($translationOptions->{r_source}) ) {
00284         # the source for the problem is already given to us as a reference to a string
00285         $source = ${$translationOptions->{r_source}};
00286     } else {
00287         # the source isn't given to us so we need to read it 
00288         # from a file defined by the problem
00289         
00290         # we  grab the sourceFilePath from the problem
00291         $sourceFilePath = $problem->source_file;
00292             
00293         # the path to the source file is usually given relative to the 
00294         # the templates directory. Unless the path starts with / assume
00295         # that it is relative to the templates directory
00296         
00297         $sourceFilePath = $ce->{courseDirs}->{templates}."/"
00298                      .$sourceFilePath unless ($sourceFilePath =~ /^\//);
00299         #now grab the source
00300         eval {$source = readFile($sourceFilePath) };
00301         $readErrors = $@ if $@;
00302      }
00303      
00304     ############################################################################
00305     # put the source into the translator object
00306     ############################################################################
00307     
00308     eval { $translator->source_string( $source ) } unless $readErrors;
00309     $readErrors .="\n  $@ " if $@;
00310     if ($readErrors) {
00311         # well, we couldn't get the problem source, for some reason.
00312         return bless {
00313             translator => $translator,
00314             head_text  => "", 
00315             post_header_text => "",
00316             body_text  => <<EOF,
00317 WeBWorK::Utils::readFile($sourceFilePath) says: 
00318 $@
00319 EOF
00320             answers    => {},
00321             result     => {},
00322             state      => {},
00323             errors     => "Failed to read the problem source file.",
00324             warnings   => "$warnings",
00325             flags      => {error_flag => 1},
00326             pgcore     => $translator->{rh_pgcore},
00327         }, $class;
00328     }
00329     
00330     ############################################################################
00331     # install a safety filter
00332     # FIXME -- I believe that since MathObjects this is no longer operational
00333     ############################################################################
00334     #warn "PG: installing a safety filter\n";
00335     #$translator->rf_safety_filter(\&oldSafetyFilter);
00336     $translator->rf_safety_filter(\&WeBWorK::PG::nullSafetyFilter);
00337     
00338     ############################################################################
00339     # write timing log entry -- the translator is now all set up
00340     ############################################################################
00341 #   writeTimingLogEntry($ce, "WeBWorK::PG::new",
00342 #       "initialized",
00343 #       "intermediate");
00344     
00345     ############################################################################
00346     # translate the PG source into text
00347     ############################################################################
00348     
00349     #warn "PG: translating the PG source into text\n";
00350     $translator->translate();
00351     
00352     ############################################################################
00353     # !!!!!!!! IMPORTANT: $envir shouldn't be trusted after problem code runs!
00354     ############################################################################
00355     
00356     my ($result, $state); # we'll need these on the other side of the if block!
00357     if ($translationOptions->{processAnswers}) {
00358         
00359         ############################################################################
00360         # process student answers
00361         ############################################################################
00362         
00363         #warn "PG: processing student answers\n";
00364         $translator->process_answers($formFields);
00365 
00366         ############################################################################
00367         # retrieve the problem state and give it to the translator
00368         ############################################################################        
00369         #warn "PG: retrieving the problem state and giving it to the translator\n";
00370         
00371         $translator->rh_problem_state({
00372             recorded_score =>       $problem->status,
00373             sub_recorded_score =>   $problem->sub_status,
00374             num_of_correct_ans =>   $problem->num_correct,
00375             num_of_incorrect_ans => $problem->num_incorrect,
00376         });
00377 
00378         ############################################################################
00379         # determine an entry order -- the ANSWER_ENTRY_ORDER flag is built by
00380         # the PG macro package (PG.pl)
00381         ############################################################################
00382         #warn "PG: determining an entry order\n";
00383         
00384         my @answerOrder =
00385             $translator->rh_flags->{ANSWER_ENTRY_ORDER}
00386                 ? @{ $translator->rh_flags->{ANSWER_ENTRY_ORDER} }
00387                 : keys %{ $translator->rh_evaluated_answers };
00388 
00389         ############################################################################
00390         # install a grader -- use the one specified in the problem,
00391         # or fall back on the default from the course environment.
00392         # (two magic strings are accepted, to avoid having to
00393         # reference code when it would be difficult.)
00394         ############################################################################
00395         #warn "PG: installing a grader\n";
00396         
00397         my $grader = $translator->rh_flags->{PROBLEM_GRADER_TO_USE}
00398             || $ce->{pg}->{options}->{grader};
00399         $grader = $translator->rf_std_problem_grader
00400             if $grader eq "std_problem_grader";
00401         $grader = $translator->rf_avg_problem_grader
00402             if $grader eq "avg_problem_grader";
00403         die "Problem grader $grader is not a CODE reference."
00404             unless ref $grader eq "CODE";
00405         $translator->rf_problem_grader($grader);
00406 
00407         ############################################################################
00408         # grade the problem
00409         ############################################################################
00410         #warn "PG: grading the problem\n";
00411         
00412         ($result, $state) = $translator->grade_problem(
00413             answers_submitted  => $translationOptions->{processAnswers},
00414             ANSWER_ENTRY_ORDER => \@answerOrder,
00415             %{$formFields},  #FIXME?  this is used by sequentialGrader is there a better way
00416         );
00417         
00418     }
00419     
00420     ############################################################################
00421     # after we're done translating, we may have to clean up after the
00422     # translator:
00423     ############################################################################
00424     
00425     ############################################################################
00426     # HTML_dpng uses an ImageGenerator. We have to render the queued equations.
00427     ############################################################################
00428     my $body_text_ref  = $translator->r_text;
00429     if ($image_generator) {
00430         my $sourceFile = $ce->{courseDirs}->{templates} . "/" . $problem->source_file;
00431         my %mtimeOption = -e $sourceFile ? (mtime => (stat $sourceFile)[9]) : ();
00432         
00433         $image_generator->render(
00434             refresh => $translationOptions->{refreshMath2img},
00435             %mtimeOption,
00436             body_text => $body_text_ref,
00437         );
00438     }
00439     
00440     ############################################################################
00441     # send any queued mail messages
00442     ############################################################################
00443     
00444     if ($mailer) {
00445         $mailer->send_messages;
00446     }
00447     
00448     ############################################################################
00449     # end of cleanup phase
00450     ############################################################################
00451     
00452     ############################################################################
00453     # write timing log entry
00454     ############################################################################
00455 #   writeTimingLogEntry($ce, "WeBWorK::PG::new", "", "end");
00456     
00457     ############################################################################
00458     # return an object which contains the translator and the results of
00459     # the translation process. 
00460     ############################################################################
00461     
00462     return bless {
00463         translator => $translator,
00464         head_text  => ${ $translator->r_header },
00465         post_header_text => ${ $translator->r_post_header},
00466         body_text  => ${ $body_text_ref } ,
00467         answers    => $translator->rh_evaluated_answers,
00468         result     => $result,
00469         state      => $state,
00470         errors     => $translator->errors,
00471         warnings   => $warnings,
00472         flags      => $translator->rh_flags,
00473         pgcore     => $translator->{rh_pgcore},
00474     }, $class;
00475 }
00476 
00477 1;
00478 
00479 __END__
00480 
00481 =head1 OPERATION
00482 
00483 WeBWorK::PG::Local goes through the following operations when constructed:
00484 
00485 =over
00486 
00487 =item Create a translator
00488 
00489 Instantiate a WeBWorK::PG::Translator object.
00490 
00491 =item Set the directory hash
00492 
00493 Set the translator's directory hash (courseScripts, macros, templates, and temp
00494 directories) from the course environment.
00495 
00496 =item Evaluate PG modules
00497 
00498 Using the module list from the course environment (pg->modules), perform a
00499 "use"-like operation to evaluate modules at runtime.
00500 
00501 =item Set the problem environment
00502 
00503 Use data from the user, set, and problem, as well as the course
00504 environemnt and translation options, to set the problem environment. The
00505 default subroutine, &WeBWorK::PG::defineProblemEnvir, is used.
00506 
00507 =item Initialize the translator
00508 
00509 Call &WeBWorK::PG::Translator::initialize. What more do you want?
00510 
00511 =item Load IO.pl, PG.pl and dangerousMacros.pl
00512 
00513 These macros must be loaded without opcode masking, so they are loaded here.
00514 
00515 =item Set the opcode mask
00516 
00517 Set the opcode mask to the default specified by WeBWorK::PG::Translator.
00518 
00519 =item Load the problem source
00520 
00521 Give the problem source to the translator.
00522 
00523 =item Install a safety filter
00524 
00525 The safety filter is used to preprocess student input before evaluation. The
00526 default safety filter, &WeBWorK::PG::safetyFilter, is used.
00527 
00528 =item Translate the problem source
00529 
00530 Call &WeBWorK::PG::Translator::translate to render the problem source into the
00531 format given by the display mode.
00532 
00533 =item Process student answers
00534 
00535 Use form field inputs to evaluate student answers.
00536 
00537 =item Load the problem state
00538 
00539 Use values from the database to initialize the problem state, so that the
00540 grader will have a point of reference.
00541 
00542 =item Determine an entry order
00543 
00544 Use the ANSWER_ENTRY_ORDER flag to determine the order of answers in the
00545 problem. This is important for problems with dependancies among parts.
00546 
00547 =item Install a grader
00548 
00549 Use the PROBLEM_GRADER_TO_USE flag, or a default from the course environment,
00550 to install a grader.
00551 
00552 =item Grade the problem
00553 
00554 Use the selected grader to grade the problem.
00555 
00556 =back
00557 
00558 =head1 AUTHOR
00559 
00560 Written by Sam Hathaway, sh002i (at) math.rochester.edu.
00561 
00562 =cut
Generated on Fri Jun 8 22:55:34 2012 for WeBWorK2 by  1.6.3
